sen.j: 平 頼綱（たいら の よりつな、生年未詳 - 正応6年4月22日 (旧暦)（1293年5月29日））は、鎌倉時代の北条氏得宗家の被官（御内人）で、鎌倉幕府8代執権北条時宗・9代執権北条貞時の執事である。
sen.e: TAIRA no Yoritsuna (year of birth unknown - May 29, 1293) was hikan (a junior official, notably 'miuchibito' or private vassal) of the Tokuso family of the Hojo clan, serving as a butler for Tokimune HOJO the 8th regent and Sadatoki HOJO the 9th regent.

TAIRA no Yoritsuna (year of birth unknown - May 29, 1293) was a private vassal of the Tokuso family of the Hojo clan (miuchibito), serving as a butler for the Eighth Regent Tokimune HOJO and the Ninth Regent Sadatoki HOJO of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 「被官」→ここでは律令制下の下級官吏ではなく、「臣下」を意味すると思います。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E8%A2%AB%E5%AE%98）「鎌倉幕府」の訳を挿入しました。「8代」「9代」→数字はスペルアウトします。（用語統一リスト）
sen.e: TAIRA no Yoritsuna (year of birth unknown - May 29, 1293) was a private vassal of the Tokuso family of the Hojo clan (miuchibito), serving as a butler for the Eighth Regent Tokimune HOJO and the Ninth Regent Sadatoki HOJO of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 平盛綱 (三郎兵衛尉)の子・平盛時の弟。
sen.e: He was the son of TAIRA no Moritsuna (Saburobe no Jo) and the younger brother of TAIRA no Moritoki.
sen.cmt: 「尉」（じょう）はおそらくlieutenantの意味ではなく、また検非違使の職についたのは頼綱の息子だけなので、その等級を表わすとは限らないようです。ここでは不正確な訳を付すよりは、名の一部として扱い、そのまま表記します。以下同様です。
sen.e: He was the son of TAIRA no Moritsuna (Saburo, Hyoe no Jo [Lieutenant of the Middle Palace Guards]) and younger brother of TAIRA no Moritoki.
sen.cmt: 「三郎兵衛尉」→「三郎（通称） + 兵衛尉（ひょうえのじょう、役職名）」だと思います。
sen.e: He was the son of TAIRA no Moritsuna (Saburo, Hyoe no Jo [Lieutenant of the Middle Palace Guards]) and younger brother of TAIRA no Moritoki.

sen.j: 北条貞時の乳母父。
sen.e: He was the foster father of Sadatoki HOJO.
He was the foster father of Sadatoki HOJO.
He was the foster father of Sadatoki HOJO.

sen.j: 通称は、平新左衛門尉、出家後に平禅門など。
sen.e: His cognomen was TAIRA no Shinzaemon no Jo and was later christened Heizenmon when he became a Buddhist priest.
He was commonly called Heishin Saemon no Jo (officer of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and later took the name of Heizenmon when he became a Buddhist priest.
sen.cmt: 「平新左衛門尉」→「へいしん + さえもんのじょう」だと思います。（http://katohjuk-web.hp.infoseek.co.jp/aduma34-01.htm, http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%B9%B3%E9%A0%BC%E7%B6%B1)"cognomen"には「あだ名」の意味がありますが、「通称」とは少し違うと思います。（http://www.thefreedictionary.com/cognomen）"christen"は通常キリスト教徒に使う語だと思います。
sen.e: He was commonly called Heishin Saemon no Jo (officer of the Left Division of Outer Palace Guards) and later took the name of Heizenmon when he became a Buddhist priest.

sen.j: 法名は杲円（こうえん）。
sen.e: His 'homyo' (posthumous Buddhist name) was Koen.
His homyo (Buddhist name) was Koen.
sen.cmt: 「法名」→頼綱は出家しているので、死後の名ではなく、出家したときに授かった名前だと思います。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%B3%95%E5%90%8D）"posthumous"を削除しました。名詞をくくる' 'を削除しました。
sen.e: His homyo (Buddhist name) was Koen.

sen.j: 頼綱の家系は平資盛を祖とするというが、これは仮冒された系譜という疑問視がある。
sen.e: The progenitor of Yoritsuna's family was allegedly TAIRA no Sukemori, which some question as to its authenticity.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「仮冒された系譜という疑問視」を直訳すれば、some question as a forged genealogyとなりましょうが、英語としては左記の方がいいように思います。
sen.e: The progenitor of Yoritsuna's family was allegedly TAIRA no Sukemori, but some question its authenticity.
sen.cmt: "question"の目的語は"its authenticity"の方が簡潔です。
sen.e: The progenitor of Yoritsuna's family was allegedly TAIRA no Sukemori, but some question its authenticity.

sen.j: 実際は平氏姓関氏の流れとする。
sen.e: In reality he was of the Seki clan whose members assumed the surname of Taira.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They consider that in reality, he was from the Seki clan whose members assumed the surname of Taira.
sen.cmt: 前の文からの流れを考えると、ここで"was"と言い切れないと思います。
sen.e: They consider that in reality, he was from the Seki clan whose members assumed the surname of Taira.

sen.j: 得宗家の執事は内管領とも呼ばれるが、これは「得宗の家政を司る長」の意味であり、幕府の役職名ではない。
sen.e: A butler for the Tokuso family was sometimes called 'Uchikanrei,' which meant 'the chief steward of the Tokuso family' and hence did not refer to the governmental post in the Kamakura bakufu.

sen.j: 父盛綱が長崎平左衛門尉盛綱と長崎氏を称したことが近世の史料にあるが、同時代の史料にはそのような記述はない。
sen.e: Although a historical document from pre-modern times mentions that Yoritsuna's father, Moritsuna, called himself Heizaemon no Jo Moritsuna NAGASAKI, assuming the surname of the Nagasaki clan, no such account is found in the documents from his times.

Although a historical document from pre-modern times mentions that Yoritsuna's father, Moritsuna, called himself Hei no Saemon no Jo Moritsuna NAGASAKI, assuming the surname of the Nagasaki clan, no such account is found in the documents from his times.

sen.e: Although a historical document from pre-modern times mentions that Yoritsuna's father, Moritsuna, called himself Hei no Saemon no Jo Moritsuna NAGASAKI, assuming the surname of the Nagasaki clan, no such account is found in the documents from his times.

sen.j: ただし、盛綱・頼綱父子は、後に内管領となった長崎高綱（円喜）・長崎高資父子とは同族である。
sen.e: However, Moritsuna and Yoritsuna were of the same family as Takatsuna NAGASAKI (Enki) and his son Takasuke NAGASAKI, both of whom later became Uchikanrei.
However, Moritsuna and Yoritsuna were of the same family as Takatsuna NAGASAKI (Enki) and his son Takasuke NAGASAKI, both of whom later became Uchikanrei.
However, Moritsuna and Yoritsuna were of the same family as Takatsuna NAGASAKI (Enki) and his son Takasuke NAGASAKI, both of whom later became Uchikanrei.

sen.j: 頼綱には、嫡子長崎宗綱（長崎平太郎左衛門尉宗綱）、次男飯沼資宗（飯沼安房判官為綱、飯沼助宗）、三男長崎頼基（長崎三郎左衛門頼基）、四男長崎高頼（長崎四郎高頼）の4人の子がいる。
sen.e: Yoritsuna had the following four sons: his eldest son, Munetsuna NAGASAKI (Heitarozaemon no Jo Munetsuna NAGASAKI); his second son, Sukemune (資宗) IINUMA (Tametsuna IINUMA, hangan (judge) of Awa Province, Sukemune (助宗) IINUMA); his third son, Yorimoto NAGASAKI (Saburozemon Yorimoto NAGASAKI); his forth son, Takayori NAGASAKI (Shiro Takayori NAGASAKI).

Yoritsuna had the following four sons: the eldest son Munetsuna NAGASAKI (Hei no Taro Saemon no Jo Munetsuna NAGASAKI), the second son Sukemune (資宗) IINUMA (Tametsuna IINUMA, hangan (judge) of Awa Province, Sukemune (助宗) IINUMA), the third son Yorimoto NAGASAKI (Saburozaemon Yorimoto NAGASAKI) and the forth son Takayori NAGASAKI (Shiro Takayori NAGASAKI).
sen.cmt: 名前を列記してある部分、セミコロンをコンマに修正しました。「長崎 / 平 / 太郎 / 左衛門尉 / 宗綱」の区切りだと思います。
sen.e: Yoritsuna had the following four sons: the eldest son Munetsuna NAGASAKI (Hei no Taro Saemon no Jo Munetsuna NAGASAKI), the second son Sukemune (資宗) IINUMA (Tametsuna IINUMA, hangan (judge) of Awa Province, Sukemune (助宗) IINUMA), the third son Yorimoto NAGASAKI (Saburozaemon Yorimoto NAGASAKI) and the forth son Takayori NAGASAKI (Shiro Takayori NAGASAKI).

sen.j: 幕府御家人で、元寇後の困窮した御家人の救済を目指した弘安徳政を推進していた安達泰盛と、御内人の利益を重んじ、御内人の中心に位置する得宗の権力強化を目指す頼綱は、政治路線をめぐって激しく対立していた。
sen.e: Putting miuchibito's interests first and seeking to reinforce the power of the Tokuso family around whom the miuchibito were organized, Yoritsuna was vehemently and politically opposed to Yasumori ADACHI who vigorously pursued political reform called 'Koan tokusei' to help the impoverished retainers after the Mongol Invasion.

sen.cmt: 「弘安徳政」をくくる' 'を削除しました。

sen.j: 1284年（弘安7年）4月、執権時宗が死去し、息子貞時が執権に就任すると対立は更に激化した。
sen.e: Their opposition became worsened when Regent Tokimune died in April 1284 and his son Sadatoki took over the regency.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 時宗は1284年4月27日に死去。
sen.e: Their conflict became worse when Regent Tokimune died in April 1284 and his son Sadatoki took over the regency.
sen.cmt: "opposition"は「反対」なので、"conflict"が適切だと思います。"became worsened"→"became worse"に修正しました。
sen.e: Their conflict became worse when Regent Tokimune died in April 1284 and his son Sadatoki took over the regency.

sen.j: 1285年（弘安8年）11月、ついに鎌倉市街で武力衝突にいたる。
sen.e: It culminated in a violent clash that took place in the streets of Kamakura in December 1285.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 霜月騒動は弘安8年11月17日（1285年12月21日）です。
sen.e: It culminated in a violent clash that took place in the streets of Kamakura in December 1285.
It culminated in a violent clash that took place in the streets of Kamakura in December 1285.

sen.j: これを霜月騒動という。
sen.e: This clash is called the Shimotsuki Incident.
This clash is called the Shimotsuki Incident.
This clash is called the Shimotsuki Incident.

sen.j: 執権貞時を奉じる頼綱はこの戦いに勝利して、泰盛一族と与同勢力は滅亡し、少弐景資ら泰盛の与党は一掃された。
sen.e: Yoritsuna serving for Regent Sadatoki won the battle, while Yasumori's family and their allies were brought to destruction and the members of his faction in the government such as Kagechika SHONI were all dismissed.

Yoritsuna serving for Regent Sadatoki won the battle, while Yasumori's family and their allies were brought to destruction and the members of his faction in the government such as Kagesuke SHONI were all dismissed.

sen.j: この後頼綱は、しばらくは追加法を頻繁に出す等の手続きを重視した政治を行っていた。
sen.e: After the Incident he briefly focused on the procedural aspects of politics by frequently issuing additional laws.

sen.e: After the Incident Yoritsuna briefly focused on the procedural aspects of politics by frequently issuing additional laws.
sen.cmt: 固有名詞「頼綱」を挿入しました。

sen.j: 1287年（弘安10年）に7代征夷大将軍源惟康が立親王して惟康親王となってからは恐怖政治を敷くようになる。
sen.e: When Prince Koreyasu, the 7th Seii Taishogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Kamakura bakufu) underwent the coming-of-age ritual and became Imperial Prince in 1287, Yoritsuna turned to a "Reign of Terror.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 「立親王する」は元服して親王となることのようです。この時期「征夷大将」は本来の意味を喪失し、Commander-in-Chiefの意味で使われています。以下同様です。
sen.e: When MINAMOTO no Koreyasu, the Seventh Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians), underwent the coming-of-age ritual and became Imperial Prince in 1287, Yoritsuna turned to a reign of terror.
sen.cmt: 「源惟康」→修正しました。「征夷大将軍」を修正しました。（用語統一リスト）「恐怖政治」は固有名詞のように頭文字を大文字にする必要はないと思います。「7代」→数字はスペルアウトします。（用語統一リスト）
sen.e: When MINAMOTO no Koreyasu, the Seventh Seii Taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians), underwent the coming-of-age ritual and became Imperial Prince in 1287, Yoritsuna turned to a reign of terror.

sen.j: （この立親王は惟康を将軍職から退け京都へ追放するための準備であるという）。
sen.e: (Koreyasu was made Imperial Prince to be dismissed from the office of Shogun and expelled to Kyoto).

sen.j: しかし、これは幕府内部に不満を呼び起こすとともに貞時にも不安視された。
sen.e: This however aroused discontent within the bakufu government and made Sadatoki apprehensive.

sen.j: ついに1293年（正応6年）4月、鎌倉大地震が起きた際に経師ヶ谷の自邸を貞時の軍勢に急襲される。
sen.e: When Kamakura was hit by a great earthquake in May 1293, Yorimori's house in Kyoshigayatsu was raided by Sadatoki's troops.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 鎌倉大地震は1293年5月26日に起きました。
sen.e: In the end, when Kamakura was hit by a great earthquake in May 1293, his house in Kyoshigayatsu was raided by Sadatoki's troops.

sen.j: 頼綱は自害し頼綱一族は抹殺された。
sen.e: Yoritsuna committed suicide and his family were all eliminated.
Yoritsuna committed suicide and his family were all killed.
sen.cmt: 「抹殺」→"eliminate"は「排除する」なので、「抹殺」より意味が弱いと思います。

sen.j: これを平禅門の乱（へいぜんもんのらん）という。
sen.e: This is called the Heizenmon Incident.

sen.j: ちなみに、この地震を機に、正応の年号は8月に永仁に改元されている。

sen.j: 晩年は次子飯沼資宗（助宗・為綱）が、得宗被官としては異例の検非違使、更に安房国国司となっている。
sen.e: In Yorimori's later years, his second son, Sukemune (資宗) (Sukemune spelt as 助宗, also known as Tametsuna) IINUMA, was promoted to 'kebiishi' (an official with judicial and police powers) and later to the 'kokushi' (provincial governor) of Awa Province, which was exceptional for a private vassal of the Tokuso family.

sen.j: 頼綱は自家の家格の上昇に腐心していたようである。

sen.j: 『とはずがたり』には、正応2年（1289年）に鎌倉を追放された将軍惟康親王に代わって久明親王を迎える際に、検非違使として迎えに出立した頼綱の子資宗が「流され人ののぼり給ひしあとをば通らじ」と詠んで足柄山に向かったという。
sen.e: "Towazugatari" (The Confessions of Lady Nijo) recounts that Sukemune, Yorimori's son, went to Mt. Ashigara as kebiishi to receive Imperial Prince Hisaaki, who was to replace Imperial Prince Koreyasu the Shogun who was expelled from Kamakura in 1289, after he composed the following poem: 'I shall follow the footsteps of the one who has been expelled.'

sen.j: 「昔、平左衛門頼綱は数え切れないほどの虐殺を行った。ここには彼の邸があり、彼が殺されると建物は地中に沈んでいった。人々はみな、生きながら地獄に落ちていったのだと語り合い、それ故に今に至るまで平左衛門地獄と呼んでいます。」
sen.e: 'Heizaemon Yoritsuna massacred an innumerable number of people. His house which used to be around here was swallowed up by the earth when he was murdered. Everybody said that he went to hell alive, and that is why up until now this place is called 'Heizaemon's Hell.'

'Heizaemon (Hei no Saemon no Jo) Yoritsuna massacred an innumerable number of people. His house which used to be here was swallowed up by the earth when he was murdered. Everybody said that he went to hell alive, and that is why up until now this place has been called Heizaemon's Hell.'
sen.cmt: ３つに分かれていましたが、「」に括られた文なので、ひとつにまとめました。「平左衛門頼綱」→平左衛門の読みは、平左衛門地獄（へいざえもんじごく）と呼ぶようになった、とあることから、「へいざえもん」だと思いますが、意味は「平左衛門尉」だと思います。（http://www.shishikukai.or.jp/sisin/sisin0306.html）

sen.j: このように頼綱の死後80年以上経っても、その恐怖政治の記憶が伝えられていた。
sen.e: Thus, Yoritsuna's reign of terror was remembered more than 80 years after his death.

tit.j: 平頼綱という呼称について
tit.e: The Name of TAIRA no Yoritsuna
The Name of TAIRA no Yoritsuna

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府草創の時に、初代征夷大将軍源頼朝が御家人に対して、例えば梶原景時（たいら・の・かげとき）といった「本姓」＋「諱」の名乗りを禁じた。
sen.e: At the beginning of the Kamakura period, the retainers were forbidden by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, the First Commander-in-Chief, from assuming a name made up with 'honsho' (a real family name) followed by 'imina' (a taboo name): e.g. TAIRA no Kagetoki.
sen.cmt: 赤字部分は平景時の間違いだと思います。ここでは読みにあわせました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At the beginning of the Kamakura period, the retainers were forbidden by the First Seii Taishogun MINAMOTO no Yoritomo from assuming a name made up with 'honsei' (real family name) followed by 'imina' (real given name): e.g. TAIRA no Kagetoki.
sen.cmt: 「征夷大将軍」→修正しました。（用語統一リスト）「本姓」→「ほんせい」と読むようです。（http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%9C%AC%E5%A7%93）「諱」→本名のこと。
sen.e: At the beginning of the Kamakura period, the retainers were forbidden by the First Seii Taishogun MINAMOTO no Yoritomo from assuming a name made up with 'honsei' (real family name) followed by 'imina' (real given name): e.g. TAIRA no Kagetoki.

sen.j: 梶原平三（かじわら・へいざ）といった「名字」＋「通称」の名乗りを求めた。
sen.e: They were instead requested to use a name composed of 'myoji' (a surname) plus 'tsusho' (a cognomen): KAJIWARA Heiza.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 ここは呼称の説明なので、名前の順番を日本語のままにしています。
sen.e: They were instead requested to use a name composed of 'myoji' (surname) plus 'tsusho' (common name): for example, KAJIWARA Heiza.
sen.cmt: cognomenには「あだ名」の意味がありますが、「通称」とは少し違うと思います。（http://www.thefreedictionary.com/cognomen）
sen.e: They were instead requested to use a name composed of 'myoji' (surname) plus 'tsusho' (common name): for example, KAJIWARA Heiza.

sen.j: 以来、非御家人の間にも名字を名乗ることが浸透していった。
sen.e: Non-retainers had since begun to use surnames.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since then, non-retainers also began to use surnames.
Since then, non-retainers also began to use surnames.

sen.j: 頼綱の一族は長崎氏である。
sen.e: Yoritsuna's family belonged to the Nagasaki clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoritsuna's family belonged to the Nagasaki clan.
Yoritsuna's family belonged to the Nagasaki clan.

sen.j: 頼綱が生きていた時代に長崎氏という氏族があったり、頼綱本人が長崎氏を称したりしたことを示す同時代の史料はない。
sen.e: Yet there is no historical records from his times, suggesting that the clan called Nagasaki actually existed, or that Yoritsuna called himself Nagasaki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: かといって頼綱が長崎とは別の名字を名乗ったという記録もない。
sen.e: Nor is there any record to indicate that Yoritsuna used a different surname from Nagasaki.
Nor is there any record to indicate that Yoritsuna used a different surname from Nagasaki.

sen.j: そこで便宜上、姓である平氏を使って平頼綱と記すことが慣例となっている。
sen.e: For these reasons he is conventionally called TAIRA no Yoritsuna based on his surname.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For these reasons he is conventionally called TAIRA no Yoritsuna based on his honsei.
sen.cmt: 「姓」→既出の文で説明済みの「本姓 (honsei)」のこと。"surname"は「名字」の訳にしているので、ここでは不適切です。
sen.e: For these reasons he is conventionally called TAIRA no Yoritsuna based on his honsei.

sen.j: （「吾妻鏡」に「平新左衛門三郎頼綱」や「平新左衛門尉頼綱」とあることから、少なくとも、当時の同時代人の間で頼綱が平姓であると考えられていたことは確実である）。
sen.e: (We know for sure, at least, that his contemporaries thought his surname was Taira since he is referred to as 'TAIRA no Shinzaemon Saburo Yoritsuna' or 'TAIRA no Shinzaemon no jo Yoritsuna' in 'Azuma Kagami' (The Mirror of the East)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: (We know for sure, at least, that his contemporaries thought that his honsei was Taira [平] since he is referred to as 'Heishin Saemon Saburo Yoritsuna' [平新左衛門三郎頼綱] or 'Heishin Saemon no Jo Yoritsuna' [平新左衛門尉頼綱] in 'Azuma Kagami' [The Mirror of the East]).
sen.cmt: 「姓」→既出の文で説明済みの「本姓 (honsei)」のこと。"surname"は「名字」の訳にしているので、ここでは不適切です。「平新/左衛門/三郎/頼綱」「平新/左衛門尉/頼綱」の区切りだと思います。（http://katohjuk-web.hp.infoseek.co.jp/aduma34-01.htm）名前から平姓と考えられていたことが分かるよう、漢字表記を挿入しました。
